item.text: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah’s reign, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched up against all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> his <st data-num="07262" class="">chief adviser</st><n id="1" /> from <st data-num="03923" class="">Lachish</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>,<n id="2" /> along with a <st data-num="03515" class="">large</st> <st data-num="02426" class="">army</st>. The chief adviser<n id="3" /> <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> at the <st data-num="08585" class="">conduit</st> of the <st data-num="05945" class="">upper</st> <st data-num="01295" class="">pool</st> that is located on the <st data-num="04546" class="">road</st> to the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> where they <st data-num="03526" class="">wash and dry cloth</st>.<n id="4" />
Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace supervisor, accompanied by Shebna the scribe and Joah son of Asaph, the secretary, went out to meet him.
The chief adviser said to them, “Tell Hezekiah: ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: “What is your source of confidence?

Your <st data-num="0559" class="">claim</st> to have a <st data-num="06098" class="">strategy</st> and <st data-num="04421" class="">military</st> <st data-num="01369" class="">strength</st> is <st data-num="0389" class="">just</st> <st data-num="08193" class="">empty</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">talk</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">In</st> <st data-num="04310" class="">whom</st> are you <st data-num="0982" class="">trusting</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> you would dare to <st data-num="04775" class="">rebel</st> against me?

<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, you must be <st data-num="0982" class="">trusting</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, <st data-num="02088" class="">that</st> <st data-num="07533" class="">splintered</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">reed</st> <st data-num="04938" class="">staff</st>. <st data-num="0834" class="">If</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">someone</st> <st data-num="05564" class="">leans</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it <st data-num="05564" class="">for support</st>, it <st data-num="0935" class="">punctures</st> his <st data-num="03709" class="">hand</st> and <st data-num="05344" class="">wounds</st> him. <st data-num="03651" class="">That is what</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> does to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="0982" class="">trust</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> him!

Perhaps you will tell me, ‘We are trusting in the Lord our God.’ But Hezekiah is the one who eliminated his high places and altars and then told the people of Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship at this altar.’

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="06148 04994">make a deal</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>, and I will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> you <st data-num="0505">2,000</st> <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st>, <st data-num="0518" class="">provided</st> you <st data-num="03201" class="">can</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">find</st> enough <st data-num="07392" class="">riders</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> them.

<st data-num="0349" class="">Certainly</st> you will <st data-num="0349" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07725 06440">refuse</st> <st data-num="0259 06346">one</st> of my <st data-num="0113" class="">master’s</st> <st data-num="06996" class="">minor</st> <st data-num="05650">officials</st> and <st data-num="0982" class="">trust</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> for <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="06571" class="">horsemen</st>.<n id="1" />
Furthermore it was by the command of the Lord that I marched up against this land to destroy it. The Lord told me, ‘March up against this land and destroy it!’”’”

Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the chief adviser, “Speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Don’t speak with us in the Judahite dialect in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”

But the chief adviser said, “My master did not send me to speak these words only to your master and to you. His message is also for the men who sit on the wall, for they will eat their own excrement and drink their own urine along with you!”
The chief adviser then stood there and called out loudly in the Judahite dialect, “Listen to the message of the great king, the king of Assyria.

<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>: ‘<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> let <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="05377" class="">mislead</st> you, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he is <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="05337" class="">rescue</st> you!
Don’t let Hezekiah talk you into trusting in the Lord by saying, “The Lord will certainly rescue us; this city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.”

<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st>!’ <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> <st data-num="03541" class="">this is what</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>, ‘<st data-num="06213 0854">Send</st> me a <st data-num="01293" class="">token of</st> your <st data-num="01293" class="">submission</st> and <st data-num="03318" class="">surrender</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me.<n id="1" /> Then <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> of you may <st data-num="0398">eat from</st> his own <st data-num="01612" class="">vine</st> and <st data-num="08384" class="">fig tree</st> and <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> from his own <st data-num="0953" class="">cistern</st>,

<st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> I <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> and <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> you <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> a <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> just like your <st data-num="0776" class="">own</st>—a <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="01715" class="">grain</st> and <st data-num="08492" class="">new wine</st>, a <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> and <st data-num="03754" class="">vineyards</st>.
Hezekiah is misleading you when he says, “The Lord will rescue us.” Have any of the gods of the nations rescued their lands from the power of the king of Assyria?

<st data-num="0346" class="">Where</st> are the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> of <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st> and <st data-num="0774" class="">Arpad</st>? <st data-num="0346" class="">Where</st> are the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> of <st data-num="05617" class="">Sepharvaim</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">Indeed</st>, did any gods <st data-num="05337" class="">rescue</st> <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st><n id="2" /> from my <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st>?<n id="3" />
Who among all the gods of these lands have rescued their lands from my power? So how can the Lord rescue Jerusalem from my power?’”
They were silent and did not respond, for the king had ordered, “Don’t respond to him.”

Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace supervisor, accompanied by Shebna the scribe and Joah son of Asaph, the secretary, went to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and reported to him what the chief adviser had said.
